positive.review:
Given the state of the alternatives... 

(Naval Action hasn't been good in years and the devs are THE WORST, Uncharted Waters is dead, Skull and Bones is a failure. Windward Horizon plays like a browser game and Sea of Thieves is too cartoony and needs a group to enjoy the best content, Pirates of the Caribbean and Pirates of the Burning Sea are both dead too)

This game's actually pretty good. At least, the demo is good. monetisation in the full release, or a toxic community could kill it, but, as it stands now, it's worth a shot. It has potential, certainly.
this game is like if skull and bones wasnt just a cash grab and actually had BOARDING ENEMY SHIPS you know the thing pirates do.

Saw this game whilst strolling through the store looking for my next fave game and this seemed like a fair contender.

Pirates - tick.
Boats/Ships/Naval combat - tick.
MMO - tick.
Random and questionable player names - tick.

I wouldn't say that this will make it to my favourite games, at least not in its current state (which is a demo, to be fair to it) but it has great potential and I'm looking forward to seeing it progress.

Worth a go, solid demo.

Promising, Anyway played a few hours and liked what i saw feels more like an Arcade version of Naval Action, but not a bad thing as Naval Action is now terrible, Arcade means fun and i certainly enjoyed the 4 hrs I played on the Demo. Hard to give it a proper review until its released fully. More than likely will purchase it as like i said it was really enjoyable' give the demo a try and see for yourself.

I like it alot. Give me more.

The game feels nostalgic and reminds me of the ship battles in Pirates of the Caribbean Online but better feeling. The only difference is that their isnt a 1st person character you can run around with its all 3rd person and fully built around the ships.  The combat is fun and engaging but doesn't have to be your focus you can be a trader and ship goods. You can hunt pirates or players. Cant wait for the full game to drop 

(not to mention they have no shop to spend money in like most demos and early access which is very promising.)

Reminds me of the pirate: carribean hunt, its basically is a clone of that game but its been modernised with new graphics and some extra features. That game was solid, and thus so is this. It plays well, the grind isnt too hard and combat is fun. Ive not come across any bugs yet. i look forward to full release.
Really great sea game for people who enjoy both pve and pvp, looking forward to seeing the development

Haven't played a ton so far, but I'm having a great time. Never played an MMO sailing game before but they're doing it great, cool ships, upgrade paths, questing. Some of the questing is a bit tedious though, I am constantly, and I mean constantly lacking wood. And it is such a slow resource to garner so it's making the game tedious at times.

Game is pretty fun but I am worried that it will become P2W how war thunder is due to them selling ships with real money that allow you to skip actually playing the game and might be straight up better than their non p2w counterparts

Sorry but can't replace Skull and Bones. Action wise SnB overkills this game. However, this is more of better graphic version of Uncharted Waters Online, with open world. Some cannot be automated like how it's done in UWO via skills, so you have to be careful. The only complaints I have so far is combat sound/graphic effects. It sucks.

excelent game. would definitly recomend to those who enjoy sailing. Though I will note that getting new ships takes a while, but that is half of the fun. has some minor bugs, like items very occasionally not purchasing properly, but as most are low cost its not too big an issue

I‚Äôve spent about 80 hours in World of Sea Battle Demo and over 3000 hours on the first server ‚Äî and I‚Äôm satisfied. It‚Äôs a great game: simple controls, enjoyable physics, and a real sense of ship weight. Naval battles, factions, and a solid variety of ships for any task. The graphics are simple but atmospheric. I‚Äôd like to see more content, since for now it‚Äôs more or less a grind. There are many ways to make the game better ‚Äî for example, adding regular events not only for faction players. Still, the project clearly has potential.

pretty good and fun, a little bit repetitive but just like any other mmo, no technical issue found yet

One relativ big active map with a lot of action. Game who you must play it and not wach it like many other games in this days. It is FSP, MMO and arcad game with a lot of reality. You can play it as PVP or PVE or mix of bouth what i like it. 
What i like a lot is, you dont loss your progres, only your pride when you loss the battel.
I truly cant wait to see this release. Its not perfect right now, but it has insane potential. If the devs want feedback im here to give it.

The game is really amazing and it's worth it if you're into naval action. It has a great start with a promising demo to boot off.

The open-world is fluid and engaging. During the demo I had no connection issues and the game ran smoothly. The combat requires real strategy beyond pointing and shooting. Having to factor in the wind, ammo type, and size of your ship compared to the enemy's will determine the result. Having a boarding mechanic is also a nice touch (unlike a AAAA game) and it has a little mini-game that doesn't make you just sit and watch for 50/50 result. Whether you're a person who likes to play solo or with friends there are ways to get around having to fight stronger vessels. For the solo players, you can add ships you've defeated in a boarding to your fleet and for the MMO players, you can create/join a guild on full release.

The game's open-world structure doesn't have a story, but it has a lot of freedom and progression. There are many ships to unlock and upgrade throughout your playtime. Whether you want to be a pirate, a trader, or apart of the military you can choose what you want to do or be apart of freely.

I was only disappointed with the fishing mechanic. I do enjoy a fishing mini-game whenever they're available, but here it's a press of a button. I do hope it's a placeholder until there is one added. Please devs I beg of you!

Despite that, the demo was a great experience, I wasn't able to get too far into the game, but with the game releasing soon I'm excited to get into the world and see what it has to offer.

I enjoyed it! Will be getting this one once it becomes available. 
My thanks to the team that put this together, well done, and thank you!

As an age of sail gamer, who has spent significant time on many other titles. I can say without a doubt that with proper care and regular future updates/content by the developers, this game can surpass all the other titles that has thus far been created. This game has an old school vibe meets new generation feel. I am excited to see this game succeed and make big waves in the age of sail community once released. plus its free :)
Really Enjoyed this Demo will be playing the game. No lag in the server and pretty laid back if you like Naval Combat games.
its very fun but the qwerty keyboard layout should be support imho
This is exactly what skull and bones was supposed to be. Absolutely fantastic game cannot wait to see it after full release. Its a must play if you enjoy ship pvp.
Great game. Graphics could be better but the Open World Combat is awesome!

THIS GAME got huge potencial - if they keep trading realistic/ trade and improving it like BDO online for years -- it got everything people wish for -- ooh yes increase game size 1000 + -- so people can get really lost with unlimited adventures

and you can make BILLIONS -- 

endgame should be just the beginning -- like in real life :)
The arcade feel is nice for a ship game. Its looks pretty good and runs really well.

This game is an absolute blast for anyone craving a fresh MMO sandbox experience! The world feels truly alive ‚Äî even with a smaller player base, you‚Äôll be surprised how often you cross paths with others out in the open seas.

PvP is intense, rewarding, and perfectly balanced between risk and reward. But the real magic lies in exploration ‚Äî the open world is bursting with life and adventure! One minute you‚Äôre teaming up with strangers to sink a merchant convoy, and the next you‚Äôre hunting down bounties on rival players.

There‚Äôs just so much to dive into that words don‚Äôt do it justice. Honestly, the best thing I can say is: give it a try. It‚Äôs free, and you even get 5 days of premium to start your journey.

Good luck out there, captain ‚Äî see you on the seas! ‚öìüî•

World of Sea Battle Demo hey so its mmorpg with ships if you like spend hours to sale like corsairs 2 meybe its good game to play online kill few pirates or be pirate arrrrrrr.... not bad idea lets see where its go
Decent chill pirates mmo, light p2w and pvp but doable.
Super fun, but seems really grindy. I've only done PVE so far.
really enjoying this, reminds me of sea dogs. great pirate game
Fun game so far.. love the amount of ships you can obtain.

Has everything Naval Action refuses to put into game since 8 years, except the realism.
Great work so far, waiting for release to grind full into it.
I can tell the devs used to play pirates online with how the ships work, and that by itself makes me happy and enjoy the game.

There was once a game like this when I was younger, I've been looking for it ever since and had no luck. BUT THIS... This gives me crazy nostalgia, haven played to much yet but man do i see the potential. WE NEEEDED a good ship game like this for so damn long.
A clone of Naval Action in its beginnings, but that isn¬¥t a bad thing...enjoyable :)
Pretty good demo puts you right into the gameplay. The concept of a pvp zone in the middle of the map is great.
Good Gameplay, Good Graphics, Good Performance
Very enjoyable game with an amazing community
Goodbye Naval Action and hello World of Sea Battle
Yo hoo, but no seriously yo ho(aka having a blast)
imagine skull and bones but fun
No hurry, but bravy sail for your glory!
I enjoy it. Hopefully the late game is good.
I enjoyed the demo. Let's see how it is on release.
i wish you could buy basic resources like iron form ports
Fun lite MMO Age of Sail game. Lots of promise
Naval action with good devs
Fun game so far.
i like boats. boats fun.
Pretty fun!
fun
Interesting.
great so far

negative.review:
imagine naval action but you take out everything thats good (the combat)
i just hope naval action devs feel threatened by this game lol

The same game has been out for YEARS without the help of steam. 
The game is fun but the ship AI is horrible. They get stuck on each other or end up running into other ships "but can literally sail right through an island" Having 3 AI ships is just asking for a HEADACHE! The problem is, they can run into other AI ships so they turn away to avoid this, but doing so throws them into a "wth is going on moment" I've watched an AI I had captured literally sail in circles for minutes. Re logging didn't help, docking in port didn't help. I ended up just scuttling the ship.

This feature also includes turning away from players "who they can't actually run into or damage" as well as each other. This game has been out for years, it will die fast on steam if the developers do not make changes. 
The player base should be listened to. Mechanics should be fixed.
The audio has a lot of bugs, it will just randomly start slowly playing through music with a lot of distortion, almost like a game that is having a MAJOR system lag but its only audio. 
Get ready for a pay to win. 
Item shop that gives a small chance for the best ships, massive resources, massive gold exchange. Bundles that sell, give player rank, gold, and ships.

18hrs in and I'm not sure what to make of it, there is no actual story, so this seems to be like a War Gaming ' battle for the sake of battle to get better stuff' game.. ok, but the economy and the sheer volume of materials needed, this is entering prime gahca territory, and for some reason, a lot of the key materials can not actually be sourced from anywhere freely, I'm reading a lot of people in the chat finding the same problem.  Either way, the time, and effort required to do all the base prerequisites, ( figuring out the UI to do that is a game in it's self), then find the materials to make the components to build a ship.. eg: a rating VI, ( rating VII-I  ship levels ),  the sheer grind, and RNG required is massive.. If you've got lots of time on your hands, go for it.. but i've lost interest, If it's this bad trying to get your first real ship, i shudder to fins what it's going to take as you make your way down the line.

I had two quests for 1200 gold deposites bug out of me so i lost 2.4k. most of the game is slowly sailing against wind and it hits a wall pretty quickly for 250 iron that youre gonna have to grind for or buy or craft.

its just really boring and these two hours  slogged by. youre not really aiming cannons or anything its just broadside combat slow and uninteractive.

Take world of tanks/ships and put it in a blender with one of those cookie cutter age of sail games, then add some fecal matter, hit blend, and you have this game. That may be a bit harsh, but the game is just a really bad version of those two game blended together. The aiming is godawful, the combat is BORING, the world is uninteresting, and there is no story or anything interesting whatsoever to keep you hooked.

I've played a lot of great age of said/pirate games, this ain't one them.

Plays like an early 2010s browsergame and looks like it too. 
Just go play pirates of the burning seas if you want an semi-arcadey ship game, because this is at best a cheap copy of it, but worse.

Gameplay: 3/5
Graphics: 3/5
Music / Sound: 1/5
Controls / Interface: 2/5
Story / Narrative: 1/5
Performance / Optimization: 4/5
Multiplayer / Online Experience: 3/5
Replay Value: 2/5
Innovation / Uniqueness: 1/5
Overall Enjoyment: 3/5

Pay2Win 

You can literally buy ingame currencies, materials and high end premium ships with money. 
Shop will open with the full release.
Very arcade. Naval Action players and Ahoy waiting crowd - I've saved 30 minutes of your life, read this and uninstall this instead of playing.  boom boom pew pew WASD toy shooting, ewwww
The moment it said "you got 5 days of premium for free" was enough to make me not want to play.

"Nice" try!

i just hope naval action devs feel threatened by this game lol

The same game has been out for YEARS without the help of steam. 
The game is fun but the ship AI is horrible. They get stuck on each other or end up running into other ships "but can literally sail right through an island" Having 3 AI ships is just asking for a HEADACHE! The problem is, they can run into other AI ships so they turn away to avoid this, but doing so throws them into a "wth is going on moment" I've watched an AI I had captured literally sail in circles for minutes. Re logging didn't help, docking in port didn't help. I ended up just scuttling the ship.

This feature also includes turning away from players "who they can't actually run into or damage" as well as each other. This game has been out for years, it will die fast on steam if the developers do not make changes. 
The player base should be listened to. Mechanics should be fixed.
The audio has a lot of bugs, it will just randomly start slowly playing through music with a lot of distortion, almost like a game that is having a MAJOR system lag but its only audio. 
Get ready for a pay to win. 
Item shop that gives a small chance for the best ships, massive resources, massive gold exchange. Bundles that sell, give player rank, gold, and ships.

18hrs in and I'm not sure what to make of it, there is no actual story, so this seems to be like a War Gaming ' battle for the sake of battle to get better stuff' game.. ok, but the economy and the sheer volume of materials needed, this is entering prime gahca territory, and for some reason, a lot of the key materials can not actually be sourced from anywhere freely, I'm reading a lot of people in the chat finding the same problem.  Either way, the time, and effort required to do all the base prerequisites, ( figuring out the UI to do that is a game in it's self), then find the materials to make the components to build a ship.. eg: a rating VI, ( rating VII-I  ship levels ),  the sheer grind, and RNG required is massive.. If you've got lots of time on your hands, go for it.. but i've lost interest, If it's this bad trying to get your first real ship, i shudder to fins what it's going to take as you make your way down the line.

I had two quests for 1200 gold deposites bug out of me so i lost 2.4k. most of the game is slowly sailing against wind and it hits a wall pretty quickly for 250 iron that youre gonna have to grind for or buy or craft.

its just really boring and these two hours  slogged by. youre not really aiming cannons or anything its just broadside combat slow and uninteractive.

Take world of tanks/ships and put it in a blender with one of those cookie cutter age of sail games, then add some fecal matter, hit blend, and you have this game. That may be a bit harsh, but the game is just a really bad version of those two game blended together. The aiming is godawful, the combat is BORING, the world is uninteresting, and there is no story or anything interesting whatsoever to keep you hooked.

I've played a lot of great age of said/pirate games, this ain't one them.

Plays like an early 2010s browsergame and looks like it too. 
Just go play pirates of the burning seas if you want an semi-arcadey ship game, because this is at best a cheap copy of it, but worse.

Gameplay: 3/5
Graphics: 3/5
Music / Sound: 1/5
Controls / Interface: 2/5
Story / Narrative: 1/5
Performance / Optimization: 4/5
Multiplayer / Online Experience: 3/5
Replay Value: 2/5
Innovation / Uniqueness: 1/5
Overall Enjoyment: 3/5

Pay2Win 

You can literally buy ingame currencies, materials and high end premium ships with money. 
Shop will open with the full release.
Very arcade. Naval Action players and Ahoy waiting crowd - I've saved 30 minutes of your life, read this and uninstall this instead of playing.  boom boom pew pew WASD toy shooting, ewwww
The moment it said "you got 5 days of premium for free" was enough to make me not want to play.

No connect to server.
"Nice" try!
